sentences.en: A rabble of angry citizens stormed the embassy.
sentences.cn: 一群愤怒的暴徒冲击了大使馆.

sentences.en: Come Midnight, let's disperse this petty rabble!
sentences.cn: 来吧!午夜! 让我们一起解决这些乌合之众!

sentences.en: Gentlemen can always fight better than rabble.
sentences.cn: 绅士们总是比乌合之众要能征善战的.

sentences.en: He doesn't mix with the rabble here.
sentences.cn: 他不与这里的下等人交往.

sentences.en: He seems to attract a rabble of supporters more loyal to the man than to the cause.
sentences.cn: 他似乎吸引了一群忠于他个人超过忠于事业的乱糟糟的拥护者。

sentences.en: I marked the deference for me evoked in the faces of my fellow - rabble.
sentences.cn: 我注意到,那与我同属贱民的人显出了对我肃然起敬的神气.

sentences.en: I was in Soweto in the antiapartheid days andout of that country for being a rabble - rouser.
sentences.cn: 反种族隔离时期,我曾在索韦托,因被视为煽动暴民者而被逐出该国.

sentences.en: In 40 years, the Guards' Polo Club has changed, but it has managed to keep most of the rabble out.
sentences.cn: 40年间，御林军马球俱乐部虽有变化，但却一直成功地把绝大多数下层民众拒之门外。

sentences.en: Poverty in itself does not make men into a rabble.
sentences.cn: 贫困自身并不能使人成为贱民.

sentences.en: Royalty , nobility, the andHow quaint ! Even the rabble.
sentences.cn: 皇亲国戚, 贵族名流, 还有,太棒了,竟然还有贱民.

sentences.en: She stumbles upon Drucker's 1973 book, and it helps her turn rabble into a team.
sentences.cn: 她碰巧发现了德鲁克1973年的书, 而这本书帮助她将那些乌合之众组织成了一支团队.

sentences.en: The hundredheaded rabble of the cathedral close.
sentences.cn: 为大教堂院内那长了一百个头的乌合之众.

sentences.en: The rabble must be kept in a short leash.
sentences.cn: 对这种下等人必须严加约束.

sentences.en: The rabble soon grew violent and unmanageable.
sentences.cn: 暴民们很快地变得狂暴和无法控制.

sentences.en: They formed an army out of rabble.
sentences.cn: 他们用乌合之众组成一支军队.

sentences.en: Yes, gentlemen always can fight better than rabble.
sentences.cn: 是啊, 绅士们总是比乌合之众要能征善战的.

words.tran_cn: 乌合之众；暴民；下层社会；（搅炼用的）长柄耙

trans.tran_cn: 乌合之众，暴民，下等人，群氓
